item.description:
What better way to de-stress if you are heading into finals (college) or a lazy Sat. afternoon than a 2.7 mile hike (with optional .7 mile extension) below the ridge topography at this 800 acre State Park. The hike starts from the parking lot at the entrance to the park, going out on an easy trail to Shadow Pond (with optional extention to Lake Louise), then back the same way to the parking lot (red to white blazed trails and back). This is a nice park with rolling ridgeline topography.

We'll meet at the parking area at the entrance (entrance is NEAR Penwood Rd, further west on Rte. 185) at 1 PM. There is no fee for parking. The hike is anticipated to take about 1.5 hours (about 2 hrs. with option) and should be done by about 2:30 PM (3 PM). A trail map can be found at the park link provided.

Kevin S. is leading on this one so please direct questions to him.

Penwood State Park map:
http://dep.state.ct.u...

PETS:
Pets on a leash are permitted in picnic areas and on hiking trails.

For more information, see http://dep.state.ct.u...
